bibl.author: Gee, N.A.
bibl.note: This is a letter from N.A. Gee to his sister Louiza, dated July 17, 1848. He writes about several deaths in his family and his remarriage. Most of the letter regards the division of their family estate, including that of two female slaves.

div1.p:
I take my pen in hand to Rite to you to Inform you that my self and family are all well at present hoping that those lines may find you and family Injoying the same I have had some misfortunes in my family I lost my wife last December Henry Died last January John died Last wednesday knight ) the Mr and Sqr Lewis has divided the land you get six hundred and forty I get three hundred and sixty seven Lewis and my self Left it to five good men agreeable to the Ritings between Brother and my self and the Estate fell in my Debt fifteen hundred dollars besides the money I paid Brother Claburn for them negroes when he was out here which was twelve hundred dollars and I have Receipts in his own hand Rite to show that I paid it I dont want any thing of you and the children only what is Rite between us If you are a mind to keep that negro gurl Martha
and give me this one heare you can doo so this one heare has two children and they can go in for the negro man that Brother was to bye for me if we have to go to law about the property it will cost us more than the property is worth sister I think its hard for you to try to keep me out of my money and give it to Lewis Mr McClinchy Gives Lewis ten per cent which will amount to about fifteen hundred dollars Crops is fine here I will make about fifty Bales of cotton and a great deel of Corn I am maried to a Miss Oldham from the western destrict Tennessee Rite to me on the Reception of this letter Rite to me whor sister Nancy lives and how they are all gitting along the county she lives in and the post office so that I can Rite to hur Give my leave to the children all and

closer.salute: Receive my Best wishes your self
closer.add:
NB Direct your letter to Burlesson county Caldwell post office sister I dount want to go to low if we and if we do I dount dount wount you to get mad with me because I always
thaut a hope of you I paid Brother every sent I ood him when he wous out her for god knoys I paid him evry and cant and I prove it by Mr Irons and others I dount think but what you beleave that I did Caldwell
